solution_line_template: Gary can bake {flour_for_cakes}/{flour_per_cake} = <<{flour_for_cakes}/{flour_per_cake}={num_cakes}>>{num_cakes} cakes from the {flour_for_cakes} pounds of flour.
He can bake {remaining_flour}/ {flour_per_cupcake} = {num_cupcakes} cupcakes from the {remaining_flour} pounds of flour.
So, he will earn ${cake_price} x {num_cakes} = $<<{cake_price}*{num_cakes}={earnings_from_cakes}>>{earnings_from_cakes} from the cakes.
Hence, Gary will earn a total of ${earnings_from_cakes} + ${earnings_from_cupcakes} = $<<{total_earnings}={total_earnings}>>{total_earnings} from baking {num_cakes} cakes and {num_cupcakes} cupcakes.
